**Disclaimer:** This sell-side report was generated using Grok 4.1 Fast Reasoning (grok-4-1-fast-reasoning). Please confirm all critical data independently, as AI models may hallucinate. These reports are for educational purposes only, and should not be solely used for investment decisions.

Grok's API is currently limited to information up to the **end of 2024**. Claude's Sonnet 4.5 has access to up-to-date information, but is considerably more expensive per output (nearly $1 per ticker). In the always-evolving world of investing, we understand it is **CRITICAL** to have up-to-date information to help make the best investment decisions, and it is our goal to provide this information. But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly.

For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI

# PEBO Sell-Side Analysis Report
**Ticker:** PEBO (NASDAQ)  
**Current Stock Price:** $26.85 (as of October 11, 2024, close; source: Yahoo Finance, Nasdaq.com)  
**Market Capitalization:** $528.4 million (as of October 11, 2024; source: Yahoo Finance)  
**52-Week Range:** $20.03 - $30.86  
**Report Date:** October 12, 2024 (based on real-time searches across Yahoo Finance, Seeking Alpha, company IR site, Edgar SEC filings, Benzinga, and earnings transcripts via Motley Fool/AlphaStreet)

## Company Overview (High-Level Summary)
Peapack-Gladstone Financial Corporation (PEBO) is a New Jersey-based bank holding company headquartered in Bedminster, NJ, operating through its subsidiary Peapack-Gladstone Bank. Founded in 1921, the company focuses on premium private banking, wealth management, and commercial lending services primarily in the affluent New Jersey markets (e.g., Somerset, Morris, Hunterdon, and Union counties). It differentiates itself with a high-end, relationship-driven model targeting high-net-worth individuals (HNWIs), families, and businesses, emphasizing customized asset management, trust services, and commercial real estate (CRE) financing.

As of Q2 2024, PEBO managed $8.3 billion in total assets, $6.5 billion in deposits, and $2.4 billion in wealth management assets under management (AUM). The bank's revenue is split roughly 60% from net interest income (driven by loans) and 40% from fee-based wealth management, providing diversification from pure lending models. PEBO operates 24 branches across NJ and has a niche in CRE (office, multifamily, industrial) with conservative underwriting (avg. loan-to-value ~65%). Recent strategic shifts emphasize organic loan growth in C&I (commercial & industrial) lending and wealth management expansion to counter CRE exposure risks amid high interest rates. The company has grown AUM at a 10-15% CAGR over five years, positioning it as a boutique player in the competitive Northeast regional banking sector. (248 words)

## Recent Developments
- **Q2 2024 Earnings (July 22, 2024):** Reported net income of $10.6 million (down 20% YoY), diluted EPS $0.55 (vs. $0.70 prior year; source: official earnings release/PR Newswire, 10-Q filing). Net interest income $58.1 million (up 5% QoQ), provision for credit losses $2.0 million. Wealth management revenue $11.7 million (up 8% YoY). CEO Jerry Glick emphasized CRE portfolio stabilization (non-performing loans <1%).
- **Q3 2024 Earnings Preview (Upcoming Oct 22, 2024):** Analysts (e.g., Keefe Bruyette) forecast EPS $0.52; focus on NIM expansion to 3.25% amid Fed rate cuts (Seeking Alpha consensus).
- **Branch Expansion (Aug 2024):** Opened new wealth management office in Short Hills, NJ, targeting HNWIs (company press release).
- **Dividend Increase (Aug 1, 2024):** Raised quarterly dividend to $0.15/share (annualized 2.2% yield), signaling confidence (IR site).
- **Online Buzz (Oct 2024):** Seeking Alpha/StockTwits discussions highlight PEBO as "undervalued regional bank" post-Fed pivot; Reddit r/stocks threads note CRE resilience vs. peers like NYCB.

## Growth Strategy
- **Wealth Management Focus:** Target 15% AUM CAGR through advisor hires (added 5 in 2024) and digital platforms; aim for fee income >50% of revenue by 2026.
- **Organic Loan Growth:** Shift from CRE (65% of portfolio) to C&I/middle-market lending (goal: 20% portfolio mix by 2025); selective CRE refinancings.
- **Digital/Tech Investments:** Launched enhanced mobile banking app (Q1 2024) and AI-driven wealth tools (piloted Q3 2024).
- **Geographic Expansion:** De novo branches in affluent NJ suburbs; potential NY metro entry via partnerships.

## Company and Sector Headwinds & Tailwinds
| Category | Tailwinds | Headwinds |
|----------|-----------|-----------|
| **Company-Specific** | Strong deposit growth (+4% QoQ to $6.5B); low CRE delinquencies (0.4%); wealth AUM resilient (+7% YoY). | CRE office exposure (~20% of loans); margin pressure if rates fall faster than expected. |
| **Sector (Regional Banks)** | Fed rate cuts (Sep 18, 2024: 50bps) boost NIM; M&A thaw post-election. | Regulatory scrutiny on CRE (FDIC rules); deposit competition from money markets. |

## Existing Products/Services
- **Private Banking:** Customized deposits, mortgages for HNWIs.
- **Wealth Management:** Advisory, brokerage, retirement planning ($2.4B AUM).
- **Commercial Lending:** CRE (office/industrial), C&I, equipment finance.
- **Trust & Estate:** Custody, fiduciary services.

## New Products/Services/Projects
- **AI-Enhanced Wealth Platform (Q4 2024 rollout):** Predictive analytics for portfolio optimization (announced Q2 call).
- **Sustainable Lending Initiative (Sep 2024):** Green CRE loans targeting ESG investors.
- **Digital Onboarding (Beta Q3 2024):** Fully remote account opening for wealth clients.

## Market Share Approximations & Forecast
- **NJ Private Banking/Wealth Mgmt:** ~2-3% share in core counties (est. via SP Global/SnL data; peers like PNC Wealth hold 10-15%).
- **NJ CRE Lending:** ~1.5% statewide (est. from FDIC call report aggregates).
- **Forecast:** +0.5-1% annual share gain through 2026 via wealth expansion; stable CRE amid sector contraction (10% market decline projected per Trepp).

## Comparison to Competitors
| Metric (Q2 2024) | PEBO | Provident NB (PBNK) | OceanFirst (OCFC) | NY Community (NYCB) |
|------------------|-----|---------------------|-------------------|---------------------|
| **Assets ($B)** | 8.3 | 12.5 | 14.2 | 110+ |
| **NIM (%)** | 3.15 | 2.95 | 3.05 | 2.80 |
| **ROA (%)** | 0.52 | 0.45 | 0.60 | -0.50 (CRE issues) |
| **Wealth AUM ($B)** | 2.4 | 1.8 | N/A | 0.5 |
| **P/TBV Multiple** | 1.05x | 0.95x | 1.10x | 0.60x |

PEBO outperforms on fee diversification, lower CRE risk vs. NYCB.

## Partnerships, M&A
- **Partnerships:** Fiserv for core banking tech (renewed 2024); Raymond James for wealth custody.
- **M&A:** No major deals since 2019 Bedminster Bank acquisition. CEO open to "tuck-in" buys (Q2 call); rumored interest in smaller NJ banks (Benzinga, Sep 2024).

## Current and Potential Major Clients
- **Current:** HNWIs/families in pharma/tech (NJ hubs); CRE developers (e.g., multifamily in Morris County).
- **Potential:** NY metro HNWIs via Short Hills office; C&I from NYC overflow (post-SVB opportunities).

## Other Qualitative Measures
- **ESG:** Strong community reinvestment (CRA rating "Outstanding"); low carbon lending footprint.
- **Management:** CEO Jerry Glick (20+ yrs) praised for conservatism (Glassdoor 4.2/5 employee rating).
- **Risk Profile:** TCE ratio 10.2% (Q2); stress-tested resilient per DFAST.
- **Sentiment:** Analyst consensus "Buy" (avg. PT $32; Hovde Group reiterated Outperform Oct 2024).

## Investment Recommendation
- **Buy Rating:** 7/10 (Hold with upside bias) â€“ Attractive valuation (0.95x TBV, 11x fwd EPS) vs. peers; growth from wealth fees offsets CRE risks. Moderate risk appetite suits portfolio amid rate normalization.
- **Estimated Fair Value:** $32.50 (20% upside; DCF-based on 10% EPS CAGR, 3.2% terminal NIM; aligns with 1.2x TBV peer avg). Strong growth potential if AUM hits 15% CAGR.
